text.headline:
Vortex,
2005 - 2015
text.text: Vortex is a little story of success: today, 10 years after its foundation by two PhD in Atmospheric Physics and a self-taught IT expert, the company has offices in three continents and serves users from 149 countries

media.caption: Pep Moreno installing a met. mast during a measurement campaign in Northern Spain. Early 90’s

text.headline: A young company made up of old experts
text.text: Vortex was born in Barcelona on September 19th 2005, but its team’s background is much older: the accumulated experience in the wind industry of its members goes back 25 years ago

media.caption: David Saez fixing the first Vortex cluster. Mid 2006

text.headline: A simple, powerfull idea
text.text: The foundational approach of the Vortex service was simple: remote modeling, on-line. As we liked to say that time, our aim was to: 'bring the power of a supercomputer to your fingerprints'

media.caption: Josep Calbó at the Universitat de Girona. Late 2006

text.headline: Research that faces the real world
text.text: Half of Vortex employees hold a PhD, we love research. However, the continuos feedback from our users makes us always come back to the real world

media.caption: Pau Casso at Longs Peak after attending the 9th WRF Users' Workshop in Boulder, CO. July 2008

text.headline: A cloud (service) with solid foundations
text.text: Vortex is not a large company but we are not at all alone: since the beginning, our core technology relies on WRF, a collaborative code developed through the effort of a community of tenths of thousands of users
